page.title: 06WALTON HEATH (THE COMMON)
page.content: Walton Heath is common land. Many people use the common. They play football, walk their dogs, and practise cricket or golf. Fifth Stone Scouts and Cubs meet in their new prefabricated building. On our field trip we saw rabbits, a grey squirrel, house martins nesting in a disused barn and a kestrel hovering. We heard a cuckoo nearby and disturbed a barn owl on Walton House Farm. Wildflowers included Red Campion, Tufted Vetch, Cow Parsely and St. John's Wort. There were Oak, Ash, Hawthorn, Beech, Willow and Holly trees. Some oaks had oak galls on them. Insects we identified were ladybirds, a burying beetle and aphids. We saw a Red Admiral and a number of Large White butterflies.
